Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the race by stating that it was the closest Senate race in Ohio in 36 years, when in fact there have been closer races in the past.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it does not provide any evidence or data to back up the statement.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that being the closest Senate race in Ohio in 36 years is a significant achievement, without considering other factors such as voter turnout or the margin of victory.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there have been closer Senate races in Ohio in the past, as stated by the expert's verdict.
